get.summary: Get a shared event (e.g. race)

put.summary: Update a shared event (e.g. race)
Update last seen message for the chat

get.summary: Get a workout

put.summary: Update a workout

delete.summary: Delete a workout (and optionally others added at the same time if the workout is on a plan)
delete.description: Returns the ids of the deleted workout(s)

get.summary: Get wellness record for date (local ISO-8601 day)

put.summary: Update the wellness record for the date (ISO-8601)
Update an array of wellness records all for the same athlete
put.description: The id of each record is the day (ISO-8601). Only fields provided are changed

put.summary: Update a wellness record, id is the day (ISO-8601)

post.summary: Upload wellness records in CSV format as multipart/form-data

get.summary: Get the athlete's weather forecast configuration

put.summary: Update the athlete's weather forecast configuration

get.summary: Get the athlete's training plan

put.summary: Change the athlete's training plan

get.summary: Get a route for an athlete

parameters.name: includePath
parameters.description: Include latlngs for the route GPS path

put.summary: Update a route for an athlete
Update a reminder
Update a gear or component
Update a range of workouts on a plan. Currently only hide_from_athlete can be changed

get.summary: List athletes that the folder or plan has been shared with

put.summary: Add/remove athletes from the share list for the folder
Update a workout folder or plan

delete.summary: Delete a workout folder or plan including all workouts

get.summary: Get an event

put.summary: Update an event

delete.summary: Delete an event from an athlete's calendar

parameters.name: others
parameters.description: If true then other events added at the same time are also deleted

parameters.name: notBefore
parameters.description: Do not delete other events on the calendar before this local date (ISO-8601)

put.summary: Delete events from an athlete's calendar by id or external_id
put.description: Delete events by id or by external_id. If external_id is supplied then the event must have been created by the calling OAuth application. If both id and external_id are supplied then external_id is used. Events that do not exist are ignored.

put.summary: Update all events for a date range at once. Only hide_from_athlete and athlete_cannot_edit can be updated

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) of oldest event to update

parameters.name: newest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) of newest event to update (inclusive)

post.summary: Create an event on the athlete's calendar
post.description: This endpoint accepts workouts in native Intervals.icu format ('description' field) as well as zwo, mrc, erg and fit files (use 'file_contents' or 'file_contents_base64')

delete.summary: Delete a range of events from the athlete's calendar

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) of oldest event to delete

parameters.name: newest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) of newest event to delete (inclusive, default is all future events)

parameters.name: createdById
parameters.description: If provided only events created by this athlete (created_by_id field) are deleted

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Comma separated list of event categories to delete (e.g. WORKOUT)

get.summary: Get a custom item

put.summary: Update a custom item
Re-order custom items
Apply any changes from the athlete's current plan to the athlete's calendar
put.description: Only workouts from today or in the future are updated

get.summary: Get the athlete with sportSettings and custom_items

put.summary: Update an athlete
Apply sport settings to matching activities (updates zones), done asynchronously

get.summary: Get sport settings by id or activity type e.g. Run, Ride etc.

put.summary: Update sport settings by id or activity type e.g. Run, Ride etc.

put.summary: Update multiple sport settings

post.summary: Create settings for a sport with default values

Split an interval

parameters.description: Index to split interval at

put.summary: Update intervals for an activity

parameters.description: Any existing intervals are replaced, otherwise a merge is done

post.description: The athlete to use is extracted from the bearer token and used to resolve power targets etc.. Note that the create workout endpoint can convert workouts and might be more convenient.

post.summary: Send a message
post.description: Returns the new message id. If a new chat was created then it is also returned.

post.summary: Create multiple new workouts in a folder or plan in the athlete's workout library

get.summary: List all the workouts in the athlete's library

post.summary: Create a new workout in a folder or plan in the athlete's workout library
post.description: This endpoint accepts workouts in native Intervals.icu format ('description' field) as well as zwo, mrc, erg and fit files (use 'file_contents' or 'file_contents_base64')

post.summary: Retire a component and replace it with a copy with the same reminders etc.
Create a new reminder
Create a new gear or component
Create new workout from .zwo, .mrc, .erg or .fit file in a folder

get.summary: List all the athlete's folders, plans and workouts

post.summary: Create a new workout folder or plan
Create a manual activity to match a planned workout
Create multiple events on the athlete's calendar
post.description: This endpoint accepts workouts in native Intervals.icu format ('description' field) as well as zwo, mrc, erg and fit files (use 'file_contents' or 'file_contents_base64')

parameters.name: upsert
parameters.description: Update events with matching external_id and created by the same OAuth application instead of creating new ones

post.summary: Duplicate workouts on a plan
Duplicate one or more events on the athlete's calendar
Convert a workout to .zwo (Zwift), .mrc, .erg or .fit.
post.description: The athlete's settings are used to resolve power targets etc.. Note that the create workout endpoint can convert workouts and might be more convenient.

Create a manual activity

get.summary: List activities for a date range in desc date order
get.description: An empty stub object is returned for Strava activities

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Local ISO-8601 date or date and time e.g. 2019-07-22T16:18:49 or 2019-07-22

parameters.name: newest
parameters.description: Local ISO-8601 date or date and time, defaults to now

parameters.name: route_id
parameters.description: Only return activities on this route

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Return at most this many activities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of field names to include in the returned objects (default is all), also excludes null values

post.summary: Create new activities from an uploaded file (fit, tcx, gpx or zip or gz of the same) as multipart/form-data
post.description: Use the 'file' form parameter to supply the uploaded file. Multisport files are split into multiple activities. Activities are de-duped using a hash of the file. Response code is 201 if at least one new activity was created and 200 otherwise (all dups).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Activity name

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Activity description

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: ID of the activity on the system it came from

parameters.name: paired_event_id
parameters.description: Workout to pair with activity

get.summary: List all messages (comments) for the activity

post.summary: Add a message (comment) to an activity

get.summary: List pace curve distances
List messages for the chat, most recent first

parameters.name: beforeId
parameters.description: Only return messages older than this one

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Return up to this many messages (default 30, max 100)

get.summary: Get a chat by id
Download one or more workouts from the athlete's calendar in a zip file

parameters.name: ext
parameters.description: Format: zwo, mrc, erg or fit

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) of oldest workout

parameters.name: newest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) of newest workout (inclusive)

get.summary: List all tags that have been applied to workouts in the athlete's library
List wellness records for date range (use .csv for CSV format)

parameters.name: oldest

parameters.name: newest

parameters.name: cols

get.summary: Get weather forecast information
Get the athlete's settings for phone, tablet or desktop
How similar is this route to another?
List routes for an athlete with activity counts
Get athlete profile info
Get the athlete's power vs heart rate curve for a date range

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting local date (ISO-8601)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Ending local date (ISO-8601), inclusive

get.summary: List best power curves for the athlete
get.description: Curves are specified as follows: 1y (past year), 2y (past 2 years) etc., 42d (past 42 days) etc., s0 (current season), s1 (previous season) etc., all (all time), r.2023-10-01.2023-10-31 (date range). Curves can also have a -kj0 or -kj1 suffix to return fatigued curves. If several of f1, f2 and f3 filter parameters are specified then each curve is returned once for each filter, for comparing curves.

parameters.name: curves
parameters.description: Comma separated list of curves to return (default last year)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The sport (Ride, Run etc.). If filters is not provided or is blank or does not contain a type filter then activities for the types of the sport matching this parameter are included

parameters.name: now
parameters.description: Current local date (ISO-8601)

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Only consider activities matching all the filters in this list

parameters.name: f1
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

parameters.name: f2
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

parameters.name: f3
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

get.summary: List best pace curves for the athlete
get.description: Curves are specified as follows: 1y (past year), 2y (past 2 years) etc., 42d (past 42 days) etc., s0 (current season), s1 (previous season) etc., all (all time), r.2023-10-01.2023-10-31 (date range). If several of f1, f2 and f3 filter parameters are specified then each curve is returned once for each filter, for comparing curves.

parameters.name: curves
parameters.description: Comma separated list of curves to return (default last year)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The sport (Ride, Run etc.). If filters is not provided or is blank or does not contain a type filter then activities for the types of the sport matching this parameter are included

parameters.name: now
parameters.description: Current local date (ISO-8601)

parameters.name: gap
parameters.description: Return gradient adjusted pace curves

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Only consider activities matching all the filters in this list

parameters.name: f1
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

parameters.name: f2
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

parameters.name: f3
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

get.summary: Get the power model used to resolve %MMP steps in workouts for the athlete
List best heart rate curves for the athlete
get.description: Curves are specified as follows: 1y (past year), 2y (past 2 years) etc., 42d (past 42 days) etc., s0 (current season), s1 (previous season) etc., all (all time), r.2023-10-01.2023-10-31 (date range). If several of the f1, f2 and f3 filter parameters are specified then each curve is returned once for each filter, for comparing curves.

parameters.name: curves
parameters.description: Comma separated list of curves to return (default last year)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The sport (Ride, Run etc.). If filters is not provided or is blank or does not contain a type filter then activities for the types of the sport matching this parameter are included

parameters.name: now
parameters.description: Current local date (ISO-8601)

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Only consider activities matching all the filters in this list

parameters.name: f1
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

parameters.name: f2
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

parameters.name: f3
parameters.description: If set each curve is returned with these filters applied to compare curves

get.summary: List athlete gear (use .csv for CSV format)
Recalculate gear stats

get.description: These have category FITNESS_DAYS (days for fitness and fatigue), SET_FITNESS (set starting fitness and fatigue) and SET_EFTP (set eFTP)

get.summary: Download a planned workout in zwo, mrc, erg or fit format

get.description: Only returns activity chats that have new_msg_count > 0 or that have been updated recently

get.summary: Summary information for followed athletes

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Local date and optional time (ISO-8601) for oldest data to return, default is 6 days ago

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Local date and optional time (ISO-8601) for newest data to return, default is today

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional list of athlete tags, only athletes with one of these tags are returned

Get best power for a range of durations for matching activities in the date range
get.description: Use ext of .csv to get results in CSV format

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Local ISO-8601 date or date and time e.g. 2019-07-22T16:18:49 or 2019-07-22

parameters.name: newest
parameters.description: Local ISO-8601 date or date and time (inclusive)

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Only return activities matching all the filters in this list

parameters.name: secs
parameters.description: Optional durations to return (default is all, in seconds comma separated)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The sport (Ride, Run etc.). If filters is not provided or is blank or does not contain a type filter then activities for the types of the sport matching this parameter are included. Required if fatigue is used

parameters.name: fatigue
parameters.description: Use kj0 or kj1 to get one of the athlete's predefined fatigued power curves

get.summary: Get best pace for a range of distances for matching activities in the date range
get.description: Use ext of .csv to get results in CSV format

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Local ISO-8601 date or date and time e.g. 2019-07-22T16:18:49 or 2019-07-22

parameters.description: Local ISO-8601 date or date and time (inclusive)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The sport (Ride, Run etc.). If filters is not provided or is blank or does not contain a type filter then activities for the types of the sport matching this parameter are included

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Only return activities matching all the filters in this list

parameters.name: distances
parameters.description: Distances required (in meters, comma separated)

parameters.name: gap
parameters.description: Return gradient adjusted pace curves

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Only return activities matching all the filters in this list

parameters.name: secs
parameters.description: Optional durations to return (default is all, in seconds comma separated)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The sport (Ride, Run etc.). If filters is not provided or is blank or does not contain a type filter then activities for the types of the sport matching this parameter are included

get.summary: Download original activity file, Strava activities not supported
Find best efforts in the activity
get.description: One of duration or distance is required

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: Stream to search

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration of each effort in seconds

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Distance of each effort in meters

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of efforts to return

parameters.name: minValue
parameters.description: Minimum average value for each interval, intervals will expand if specified

parameters.name: excludeIntervals
parameters.description: If true portions of the stream that are included in work intervals are not considered

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: First point in stream to consider

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: Last point in stream to consider (exclusive, default is whole stream)

get.summary: List events (planned workouts, notes etc.) on the athlete's calendar, add .csv for CSV output

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) for oldest event to return, default is today in the athletes timezone

parameters.name: newest
parameters.description: Local date (ISO-8601) for newest event to return (inclusive), default is oldest plus 6 days

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Comma separated list of categories to filter for (e.g. WORKOUT,NOTES)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of events to return (default is all events)

parameters.name: ext
parameters.description: Convert workouts to this format (zwo, mrc, erg or fit) and add workout_filename and workout_file_base64 to workout object

parameters.name: powerRange
parameters.description: Percentage used to convert fixed power targets into a range for outdoor workouts only (default is 2.5 or whatever is configured in the Garmin box in /settings)

parameters.name: hrRange
parameters.description: Percentage used to convert fixed HR targets into a range (default is 1.5 or whatever is configured in the Garmin box in /settings)

parameters.name: paceRange
parameters.description: Percentage used to convert fixed pace targets into a range (default is 2.5 or whatever is configured in the Garmin box in /settings)

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale (en, es, de etc.) to use for workouts with steps in multiple languages

parameters.name: resolve
parameters.description: Resolve power, heart rate and pace targets to watts, bpm and m/s respectively

delete.summary: Disconnect the athlete from the app matching the bearer token

APIKey.description: Username is API_KEY, Password is your API key found in /settings

AccessToken.description: Use bearer token for an athlete from OAuth flow
